original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields steady in mid-day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT –  Sri Lanka’s bond yields were steady in the mid-day trade on Monday after the new year holidays, dealers said.
“The market is not active on the first day of trading after the holidays” a dealer said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 27.30/28.00 percent steady from at 27.30/90 percent last week.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2025 was quoted at 25.75/26.00 steady from 25.80/26.00 percent last week.
The rupee opened at 320/320.30 to the US dollar in the spot market unchanged from Wednesday’s close at 320/325 rupees. (Colombo/ April17/2023)
